org.eclipse.keyple.plugin.pcsc

Interface PcscPlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.event.ObservablePlugin, org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.Plugin

    public interface PcscPlugin
extends org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.event.ObservablePlugin
    Provides the public elements used to manage the PC/SC plugin.
    It defines in particular the type of object produced by the PcscPluginFactory and allow to set parameters to retrieve the communication mode from the name of a reader.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.event.ObservablePlugin

    • Method Detail

      • setReaderNameFilter

        void setReaderNameFilter(boolean contactlessMode,
                         java.lang.String readerNameFilter)
        Sets a filter based on regular expressions to make the plugin able to identify the communication mode of a card reader from its name.

        For example, the string ".*less.*" could identify all readers having "less" in their name as contactless readers.

        Names are not always as explicit, so it is sometimes better to test the brand and model. Commonly used contactless readers include the "ASK LoGO" and "ACS ACR 122" models, while contact readers include "Cherry TC" or "Identive".
        Thus, an application using these readers could call this method a first time with true and ".*(ASK LoGO|ACS ACR122).*" and a second time with false and ".*(Cherry TC|Identive).*".

        Note: The use of this method is optional if the transmission mode of the readers is set directly at the reader level with the PcscReader.setContactless(boolean) method.
        Otherwise this method must imperatively be called twice to set the identification filters for both transmission modes.

        Parameters:
        contactlessMode - True if the the filter is to be associated with contactless readers, false if not.
        readerNameFilter - A string a regular expression (must be not empty).
        Since:
        1.0

      • setProtocolIdentificationRule

        void setProtocolIdentificationRule(java.lang.String readerProtocolName,
                                   java.lang.String protocolRule)
        Sets a protocol identification rule based on an ATR analysis.

        The rule is a regular expression contained in a String.

        • If a rule already exists for the provided protocol, it is replaced.
        • If there is no rule for the provided protocol, it is added.
        Note: A predefined list of identification rules is already integrated (see PcscProtocolSetting), however, depending on the type of reader used the ATR returned when presenting contactless cards may vary. It is therefore important to be able to update these rules.
        Parameters:
        readerProtocolName - A not empty String.
        protocolRule - A not empty String.
        Since:
        1.0
